title: Disney Parks Worldwide
description: Explore Disney parks around the globe!

questions.question: Which Disney park has the tallest castle?
questions.explanation: Shanghai Disneyland's Enchanted Storybook Castle is the tallest at 197 feet.

questions.question: Tokyo Disney Resort is owned by The Walt Disney Company.
questions.explanation: Tokyo Disney Resort is owned and operated by the Oriental Land Company under license from Disney.

questions.question: What unique attraction can you find at Tokyo DisneySea?

options.text: Journey to the Center of the Earth

questions.explanation: Journey to the Center of the Earth is a unique high-speed dark ride found only at Tokyo DisneySea.

questions.question: What is the castle at Disneyland Paris called?

options.text: Le Château de la Belle au Bois Dormant

questions.explanation: Disneyland Paris features Sleeping Beauty Castle (Le Château de la Belle au Bois Dormant in French).

questions.question: When did Shanghai Disneyland open?
questions.explanation: Shanghai Disneyland opened on June 16, 2016, as the newest Disney resort.

questions.question: Hong Kong Disneyland was the first Disney park in China.
questions.explanation: Hong Kong Disneyland opened in 2005, making it the first Disney park in China before Shanghai opened in 2016.

questions.question: What EPCOT-style attraction is unique to Tokyo DisneySea?
questions.explanation: Tokyo DisneySea features Mediterranean Harbor, a unique port themed after Italian and Mediterranean culture.

questions.question: Which Disney resort has a park called Walt Disney Studios?
questions.explanation: Walt Disney Studios Park is the second theme park at Disneyland Paris, opened in 2002.
